item.title: Sherry Paulette Conner add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "You believe in a book that has talking animals, wizards, witches, demons, sticks turning into snakes, burning bushes, food falling from the sky, people walking on water, and all sorts of magical, absurd and primitive stories, and you say that we are the ones that need help?" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sherry Paulette Conner add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "I pray because I can't help myself. I pray because I'm helpless. I pray because the need flows out of me all the time- waking and sleeping. It doesn't change God- it changes me." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Sherry Paulette Conner add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You can get help from teachers, but you are going to have to learn a lot by yourself, sitting alone in a room." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Sherry Paulette Conner add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "Any book that helps a child to form a habit of reading, to make reading one of his deep and continuing needs, is good for him." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Sherry Paulette Conner add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "When you're different, sometimes you don't see the millions of people who accept you for what you are. All you notice is the person who doesn't." -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: Sherry Paulette Conner add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "We must always take sides. Neutrality helps the oppressor, never the victim. Silence encourages the tormentor, never the tormented." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Sherry Paulette Conner add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "All parents damage their children. It cannot be helped. Youth, like pristine glass, absorbs the prints of its handlers. Some parents smudge, others crack, a few shatter childhoods completely into jagged little pieces, beyond repair." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Sherry Paulette Conner add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "The best antidote I know for worry is work. The best cure for weariness is the challenge of helping someone who is even more tired. One of the great ironies of life is this: He or she who serves almost always benefits more than he or she who is served." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Sherry Paulette Conner add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "I went to a bookstore and asked the saleswoman, 'Where's the self-help section?' She said if she told me, it would defeat the purpose." -- George Carlin

item.title: Sherry Paulette Conner add a quote by Laurell K. Hamilton
item.description: "There comes a point when you either embrace who and what you are, or condemn yourself to be miserable all your days. Other people will try to make you miserable; don't help them by doing the job yourself." -- Laurell K. Hamilton

item.title: Sherry Paulette Conner add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "This book taught me, once and for all, how easily you can escape this world with the help of words! You can find friends between the pages of a book, wonderful friends." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Sherry Paulette Conner add a quote by Thomas S. Monson
item.description: "May I share with you a formula that in my judgment will help you and help me to journey well through mortality... First, fill your mind with truth; second, fill your life with service; and third, fill your heart with love." -- Thomas S. Monson

item.title: Sherry Paulette Conner add a quote by Horace Annesley Vachell
item.description: "I have been crying," she replied, simply, "and it has done me good. It helps a woman you know, just as swearing helps a man." -- Horace Annesley Vachell

item.title: Sherry Paulette Conner add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "I get by with a little help from my friends." -- John Lennon

item.title: Sherry Paulette Conner add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Never mistake knowledge for wisdom. One helps you make a living; the other helps you make a life. " -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Sherry Paulette Conner add a quote by Galileo
item.description: "You cannot teach a man anything, you can only help him find it within himself." -- Galileo

item.title: Sherry Paulette Conner add a quote by Dalai Lama
item.description: "Our prime purpose in this life is to help others. And if you can't help them, at least don't hurt them." -- Dalai Lama

item.title: Sherry Paulette Conner add a quote by Kathryn Stockett
item.description: "Wasn't that the point of the book? For women to realize, We are just two people. Not that much separates us. Not nearly as much as I'd thought." -- Kathryn Stockett

item.title: Sherry Paulette Conner add a quote by Herman Hesse
item.description: "Often it is the most deserving people who cannot help loving those who destroy them." -- Herman Hesse

item.title: Sherry Paulette Conner add a quote by Kathryn Stockett
item.description: "You is kind. You is smart. You is important." -- Kathryn Stockett

item.title: Sherry Paulette Conner add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Life's most persistent and urgent question is, 'What are you doing for others?" -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Sherry Paulette Conner add a quote by Robert Half
item.description: "No one can be right all the time, but it helps to be right most of the time. " -- Robert Half

item.title: Sherry Paulette Conner add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Never worry about numbers. Help one person at a time and always start with the person nearest you." -- Mother Teresa
